conclusion: The problem involves finding the temperature of an ideal gas in state A using a p-V diagram.
The image shows a p-V diagram for an ideal gas from state A to B to C, with state C marked at 300 K.
The process from A to B is isobaric and from B to C is isochoric, allowing use of the ideal gas law.
Relate temperatures in states A and C using the ideal gas law: TA/TC = pAVA/pCVC.
Calculate TA using TC = 300 K and the pressure ratio: TA = TC Ã— (pA/pC).
Determine the pressure ratio using the inverse of the volume ratio from the image.
Conclude that the temperature in state A is 600 K.
